item.title: Support Vector Machine and Karush-Kuhn-Tucker
item.description: This article is a brief introduction about SVM and KKT. Table of Contents SVM KKT Support Vector Machine Support Vector Machine is one of the most influential techniques in supervised machine learning (Boser et al. 1992; Cortes and Vapnik et al. 1995). It is very similar to logistic regression. The main difference is it does not output probability, but, a class identity instead. SVM predicts a positive class is present when $w^Tx+b$ is positive.
